wikipedia_page.main: Robert Hutchinson (22 December 1894 – 3 August 1971) was an English professional footballer who played as an outside forward. Born in Blyth, Northumberland, he started his career in local football, before moving to Scottish club St Mirren in 1914. He went on to play for a number of Football League clubs and for two seasons, Hutchinson had a spell in the United States. In a career spanning 16 years, he played for 14 different clubs, leading him to be described as a "nomadic" footballer.
